page.title: 02Education
page.content: {Education in Llangybi and Llantrisant In February 1985, despite great opposition from parents,pupils and the community,Llangybi school was closed after being in existance since the 18th century.Llantrisant school closed the previous year.Most of the pupils aged 5_11 years are now taken buy coach to a new purpose built school in Usk which caters for about 290 pupils. Children of secondary age go from both villages by bus to Caerleon Comprehensive school.A few attend Monmouth school. A pre_school play group is held 3 mornings a week in Llangybi villa
